constraints: Check for an existing component in the codebase and extend/reuse if possible.
If building from scratch, use Radix UI Primitives as the base. Only if Radix has a suitable primitive component otherwise fallback on html.
Use data attributes for variant control (e.g., data-variant, data-mode) and class selectors for core styles/layout, following conventions in /packages/foundations/build/css/components.
Reference only tokens (CSS custom properties) as seen from figma and matching the naming convention but transformed to css custom properties
Do not use primitives or hardcoded values.
Icons must be from the approved icon system (e.g., Phosphor Icons).
Component must use React.forwardRef and support style/rest props.
All variant and state props must be reflected as data attributes for easy testing and styling.
Learn and match all styling and structure conventions from existing .module.css files and demo usage.
